item.title: Students, Faculty and Staff with Windows 10 on personal computers not managed by RPI
item.description: Microsoft Windows 10 support ends on October 14th, 2025. This means that as of this date, Windows 10 systems will cease to be eligible for support including important security patches. Without appropriate mitigation, Windows 10 systems and your data will be at significant risk. Additionally, they will be non-compliant with multiple RPI security policies and may be denied access to the campus network to reduce risk and maintain a secure cybersecurity posture. Click in for recommendations.

item.title: IT Security - Protect Your Credentials from Agentic AI
item.description: As agentic AI systems become increasingly capable of autonomous decision-making and task execution, it’s critical to understand the risks of sharing your login credentials—especially institutional ones—with these tools. item.description: Wednesday, October 8, 2025 3:00 PM - 4:00 PM – After receiving his PhD in philosophy from the CUNY, Thomas Ferguson spent several years in industry on the Cyc artificial intelligence project before joining the data firm Dun & Bradstreet as principal ontologist. After postdocs at the Inst. for Logic, Language & Computation at the University of Amsterdam, the University of St. Andrews, and the Institutes of Philosophy and Computer Science at the Czech Academy of Science, he arrived at RPI.
